text:
I have been trying to set up documentation with Documenter.jl, but I am getting this when it comes to deployment:
```┌ Warning: Documenter could not auto-detect the building environment Skipping deployment.
└ @ Documenter ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/deployconfig.jl:75```
My deployment function is as follows:
```deploydocs(
    target = "build",
    repo   = "<http://github.com/jakewilliami/SpelledOut.jl.git|github.com/jakewilliami/SpelledOut.jl.git>",
    branch = "gh-pages",
    devbranch = "master",
    devurl = "dev",
    versions = ["stable" => "v^", "v#.#.#", "dev" => "dev"],
    push_preview    = false
)```
I have added travis CI like the documentation says, I have a `Project.toml` with `SpelledOut.jl` (my package) inside my `docs` directory.  Everything is working locally, just not deploying.  Does anyone know why this is happening?

text: <@U67SCG4HG> <https://github.com/jakewilliami/ComputabilityTheory.jl|this> is the actual repo I am trying this on.  For some reason it looks like <https://travis-ci.com/github/jakewilliami/ComputabilityTheory.jl|my CI> has stopped working (I think I might need to pay money for “credit”?  I’m not entirely sure).  I can send you a build log from Documenter.jl, but do you know where the log is kept?

text: Well, where did you see the warning in your first message? that is presumably from the CI logs?

elements.text: Well, where did you see the warning in your first message? that is presumably from the CI logs?

text: You can switch to GitHub actions for free CI credits.

elements.text: You can switch to GitHub actions for free CI credits.

text:
No, the warning was during the building of the docs:
```$ julia docs/make.jl
[ Info: SetupBuildDirectory: setting up build directory.
[ Info: Doctest: running doctests.
[ Info: ExpandTemplates: expanding markdown templates.
[ Info: CrossReferences: building cross-references.
[ Info: CheckDocument: running document checks.
[ Info: Populate: populating indices.
[ Info: RenderDocument: rendering document.
[ Info: HTMLWriter: rendering HTML pages.
┌ Warning: Documenter could not auto-detect the building environment Skipping deployment.
└ @ Documenter ~/.julia/packages/Documenter/FuXcO/src/deployconfig.jl:75```
> You can switch to GitHub actions for free CI credits.
Good to know, thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Travis has recently switched to a "credits" based model and doesn't grant open source projects free credits anymore

elements.text: Travis has recently switched to a "credits" based model and doesn't grant open source projects free credits anymore

text: But that is expected when you build locally

elements.text: But that is expected when you build locally

text: Ohh, so it is the CI that actually deploys the docs??

elements.text: Ohh, so it is the CI that actually deploys the docs??
yes
CI does all the things

text: I see...  Okay, thanks guys.  It’s late here, but tomorrow I will migrate to GitHub Actions and hopefully all will be well :slightly_smiling_face:  Thanks again!
